storyInfo: Ebenholz enjoys some free time on his last day before going to the capital for sentencing. He sees some familiar faces, indulges in some memories, and finally plays the cello in the Afterglow, where music is now strictly forbidden.

attributes.content: Graf Urtica, Your Excellency, Vyseheim will come to a stop tomorrow at noon. I shall then accompany you to the capital on behalf of Stadtrat Vyseheim.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: I will assist you in investigating this incident.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Furthermore, per protocol, you will be granted freedom of movement within Vyseheim until sundown to make it easier for you to pack your bags and express your goodbyes to those of importance to you.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Of course, considering your special status, as well as the seriousness of this incident, I will personally attend to you throughout your activities in Vyseheim.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Attend me? I expected you to directly say that you're 'surveilling' me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Shrugs)
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: So, where are you planning on going? If possible, please let us know in advance so that––
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: And if I don't feel like telling you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Just a friendly reminder - I will be keeping tabs on your every word and action, and my records will greatly affect the outcome of these procedures.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Sure, sure. At this point, I'd rather hear that from some spy or agent. There's a lot more humanity to those types than the likes of you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Afterglow Hall stands as always, only now, it has fallen silent.
The plaza has thinned out. Only a few casually-dressed people still remain milling about, their eyes full of suspicion.
Please, go easy on me this one time...
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Plainclothes Guard

attributes.content: This is where Gelais drew his last breath... I just wanted to sing a song he used to enjoy, 'die Melodie für Morgen'...
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: No, get out of here! Music is strictly prohibited in this jurisdiction at the moment. Are you trying to violate the order?!
attributes.name: Plainclothes Guard

attributes.content: But I'm only going to sing a song. I don't know any Originium Arts...
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: Get out of here right now, or you'll regret it!
attributes.name: Plainclothes Guard

attributes.content: Where are you going?
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: The guard said commoners aren't allowed in, right? Since I'm a noble, I'll vouch for him.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Have you forgotten what happened the last time you brought a commoner into a music store?
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: The incident may not have had serious consequences, nor did anyone pursue the matter. Still, one time can be written off as a young man being ignorant and selfish. Two times, and the same can't be said again.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: If you ask me, you've already blurred the line between commoners and nobles in your heart, a line which one must never cross.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Seems like you've calmed down.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: I will make it known in my records that Graf Urtica has come to realize his excessive contact with commoners is one of the main reasons behind the tragedy––
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Your Excellency?!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Hello.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz?
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: Err, I mean, Graf Urtica... My apologies, I was too sad to think straight...
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: Please, don't call me that.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: About Gelais...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Say no more, I get it. I'm very grateful for your consideration.
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: But please, don't finish that sentence. They're all watching, listening.
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: Oh, right, Herr Czerny is leaving the Afterglow tomorrow. Would you like to go see him?
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: Czerny? Leaving the Afterglow?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You didn't know? He's not doing well, so Hibiscus wants to take him to Rhodes Island for treatment.
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: Thanks for telling me. I'll go to him right away.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And... my condolences.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Thank you for your kindness...
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: (Sighs audibly)
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Let's get going. And don't make trouble.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: I'll make trouble for you any day of the week.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You really think you're not making life harder for those Infected? If you really cared about them, you'd keep your distance.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Ebenholz?!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Where've you been all this time? Mr. Czerny and I have been worried half to death about you––
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Don't waste your breath, Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Czerny frowns at the figure standing behind Ebenholz. The noble remains there, motionless.
I heard Czerny was going to leave the Afterglow.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's true.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: That... isn't something I'd expect of the Czerny I know.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Such is the great Graf Urtica, brandishing his razor wit the moment he steps through the door.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That wasn't meant as an insult.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I know. Since you're here, I'd like to hear what you've been up to since they put you under house arrest––
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Watch your mouth, uncouth peasant.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: ...I'll keep that in mind. Now, might we continue our conversation, o highest of noble lords?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Now then, I'm leaving the Afterglow for three reasons.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: First, my body is in bad shape. Hibiscus was right - my life isn't forfeited yet, and I shouldn't give up my hope for a future just yet.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Is this the same Czerny who used to compose until he vomited blood? Those are some words worth recording.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't think those words are very much like me either. Hibiscus is primarily to blame, as she has been forcing these ideas upon me.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Second, I can no longer do anything for the Afterglow as it is now.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: What do you mean by that?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Stadtrat has taken over the entire district. They...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Ahem–– Ahem.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: ...have been very considerate of us.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: The day after the incident, they placed a ban on playing music in public, claiming it was to 'prevent criminal activity.'
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Music stores throughout the Afterglow have been subject to frequent investigation lately, with many of them closing permanently.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I intended to go to have a word with the Stadtrat, but even playing piano in my own home saw them 'politely' breaking into my house. They nearly attacked Ursula last time.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Have they gone mad?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If you ask me, they're afraid of––
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Halt your baseless speculation.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Your Excellency, this is not something that should be discussed with commoners.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Then, I trust you'll explain the situation in private, good sir.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ignore him, Czerny. What's your third reason?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That would be the most one. My creative process requires something a bit... different.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: After the incident, I found myself harboring some... more difficult-to-express feelings in my chest.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I need to connect with something different... something brand new, to expand the vocabulary of my music. Perhaps then, I will be able to give voice to a part of those feelings.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That's the first bit of good news I've heard all day.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I wish you the best.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz, what are you planning to do next?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Fräulein, I advise you to change the subject.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Um, is there any place you'd like to go?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: An interesting question. How can I go anywhere? Once this city comes to a stop tomorrow...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Disclosing that is a serious crime.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Well, there you have it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'll come up with something.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: With what? There is nothing to come up with.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Leaking secrets is a serious crime indeed, and there are thousands of laws in Leithanien. It's a single law I'm managing to not break here.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: My verdict hasn't been handed down yet, so all I can do is wait––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This is your last warning, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: So, this pretty much sums up the situation.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: There must be a way... I'm sure of it.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Once I'm back at Rhodes Island, I'll go see the Doctor. We'll come up with something, for sure.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Your Doctor is so incredibly capable?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Absolutely.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Why would such an incredible Doctor make such efforts for me?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Don't sell yourself short.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: If you weren't the focus of this whole mess, if it was someone else, I can't even imagine what would have become of Vyseheim.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You saw the truth. You stood up to fight. And most importantly, many people... myself included, would have died without your efforts.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Thank you. I truly appreciate your kindness, Hibiscus, but––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: After your situation settles down, you should come with us to Rhodes Island too.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Me? Go to Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Don't forget, you're Infected now. You'll need treatment, just like me and Mr. Czerny.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Rhodes Island is a landship. It won't stay in one place for too long, and it doesn't stay on a fixed track. It will cross through many countries, and may even sail to the end of the earth.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Plus, Rhodes Island is huge and has a lot of people onboard.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Remember my sister, Lava? She hates the health food I make just as much, so I'm sure the two of you will have a lot of common ground.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: So... When this is all over, Ebenholz, come to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...If I can.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: C'mon, cheer up. Don't start moping already.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Remember what Kreide said to you.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Even with how hoarse his voice was––
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You can't forget what he asked of you.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: No, I didn't forget... How could I ever forget?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then... Try your best to honor his wishes, okay?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Kreide unsteadily shambles to the center of the plaza.
With each step he takes, Originium crystals erupt from his body, his flesh and blood beginning to churn.
A strange melody lingers over the plaza.
The crystals rapidly envelop Kreide's body, transforming into armor, transforming into instruments.
In a heartbeat, the being once known as Kreide is swallowed up, and in his place stands...
(Breathes raggedly)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I... passed out again?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hibiscus? Hibiscus!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Czerny? Ursula? Where are you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You're awake, Graf Urtica?
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Where's Hibiscus? And Czerny?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That commoner and his servant have been taken away, along with the Sarkaz woman.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: But this is Czerny's house!!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Nay, it is 'a house that shelters them from the wind and rain, by the grace of Their Majesties.'
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: This is for everyone's good. If you had continued your discussion, there's no guarantee that they'd be able to leave Vyseheim tomorrow morning.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: You despicable–
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Was there something else you wanted to say?
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Nothing I'd say to you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Actually, we came to an agreement earlier. I nearly forgot.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why isn't the Stadtrat allowing music in the Afterglow?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's an edict they decided to issue, nothing more.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: I didn't think they'd fly off the handle and pass something like that. Besides, the Afterglow has always paid taxes to Vyseheim. Why would they cut their own revenue like that?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Naturally, to prevent someone from imitating that crime.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: If that was true, you wouldn't have snorted in satisfaction earlier when Czerny gave this same excuse.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You'd only feel that way if you knew he had bought into your lies.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Tch.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Let me guess... The Empresses' Voice, right?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'd watch myself, if I were you.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Seems like I'm right on the mark.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then, I'm assuming some Kurfürsten, like Lehnsfrau Gertrude––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You... You presumptuous little––!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: You're not the best at keeping secrets either, my good sir.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: By the looks of things, he's put a lot of pressure on you. Tell me, what does he think of all this?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Did you come up with this despicable plan because you wanted to exterminate the Infected of the Afterglow without causing a fuss and catching the attention of the Empresses' forces?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Show some restraint! And, I have no idea!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: That's true. Each regional Stadtrat only acts in accordance with what they're told. How would they possibly be able to see through the Kurfürsten's plans?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Are you done yet?
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: I am.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then allow me to say something.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Please return to your residence in the Cliffy Patio immediately.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: You tried to break into a restricted area, take advantage of a commoner to sow confusion, and discuss confidential information with unauthorized individuals. None of these things will reflect well in your record.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: I can't imagine you're doing this with my best interest in mind.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let me guess... Could it be that if your report doesn't look good, it also reflects negatively upon you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Don't pretend like you didn't hear me. I know everything in your bag of tricks by now.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Back in Urtica, whenever I got into trouble, I was always most afraid of my own 'agents' and 'attendants.'
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: So tell me, how do you people want me to spend the rest of my life? What's the bottom line? Be honest with me, it'll make things easier for both of us.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Sighs)
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Just go home. That's the only thing I ask of you.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: But you said I'm free to go where I please until sunset. Your own words.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Those may be the rules.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: But, those who truly understand the push and pull of these matters will do as I say. They follow the arrangements I lay out for them, and prove that they truly have remorse...
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: And yet you, and that repulsive, unrepentant air you put on like a delusional commoner – nay, like a beast that refuses to be tamed...
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Get a grip already, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Listen to me and return to your residence. I'll try to put in a few good words for you in my report.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: And if I don't?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Will your report curse me up and down? Will it reveal the terrible job you've been doing?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Clicks tongue in anger)
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: They say you're related by blood to the one whose name we dare not speak, and it's clear to me now that the same madness runs in your veins.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: So you're finally starting to be honest about me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Don't get too uppity, boy.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: You think I'm afraid of you? You're nothing more than a puppet - what could you possibly know about the art of recording?
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: I have a hundred ways to absolve you of responsibility while still keeping you in chains, understand? If you've gotten it through that thick skull of yours, return to your cell!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Sorry, but the sun isn't down yet. I'm free to go wherever I want.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: So keep following me, my cowardly friend. Not that you dare to throw your weight around with an audience.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz breaks into a sprint in a narrow alley.
He isn't even thinking about trying to shake off his pursuer.
If he manages to lose him, a new 'tail' will grow back in no time.
If he manages to shake them all, he still has nowhere to go...
Nowhere to go?
Before he knows it, his feet bring him to that place.
Looking at the familiar door and the unfamiliar barricades surrounding it, Ebenholz hesitates.
His 'tail' pants heavily, glaring at him viciously from not too far away. Ebenholz crosses the line of barricades and pushes open the door to the house.
Seeing him disappear through the door, the 'tail' follows him, gasping for breath.
Everything is the same as it was before that performance.
The cups, the dishes, the kettle.
The dirty stovetop, worn furniture, a crude bed, and... a shakedown mat.
Ebenholz suddenly wants to know what it feels like to sleep on it, so he lies down.
Pain. It hurts all over.
The hard ground seems to reject him, putting pressure on every bone in his back.
Just a few seconds makes him feel as if his spine is ready to snap.
The 'tail' glares at him contemptuously as if looking down at a beast, and he returns the same amount of malice.
He's right, anyway. He probably will end up back in chains.
But he's not particularly scared.
He isn't even that curious anymore.
If he were to be honest, he probably has already accepted the vicissitudes of fate.
While other children frolicked beneath the sunlight, he and Kreide learned to remain calm in the face of death.
After struggling to survive through a crazed experiment, one of them became a caged fowlbeast. The other ended up worse-off than an Originium slug in the sewers.
He sought freedom amidst fear, but Kreide was powerless to seek anything beyond food and clothing.
After many years, they finally reunited here.
They decided to work together to put on a concert.
Shouldn't their misfortune have ended here?
After the conclusion of the story, he was supposed to return to his post as a puppet graf, and Kreide was supposed to earn enough money and renown to treat his grandfather.
They were supposed to learn that nobody is ever alone.
But then, they stood upon that stage.
They were ready to give everything for each other.
Generally speaking, such a story should have ended with two earning a new lease on life after making it through all that suffering.
Or, even if fate was meant to torment them, they at least should have perished together, right?
But fate wanted Kreide to die for him. Fate wanted Kreide to die at the hands of the person he intended to give his life for.
Fate wanted Kreide to die, and fate wanted Kreide's death to be meaningless.
Czerny has to leave the Afterglow to seek treatment.
He continues to survive, but will soon go to the capital to face his judgment.
The people of the Afterglow are being strangled, not even permitted to sing a lamentation for their deceased loved ones.
Don't forget what Kreide said to you.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You can't forget what he asked of you.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Kreide's words––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Have I... forgotten them?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Live on, Ebenholz, and walk through the long night.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Fight injustice, and treat others with generosity and charity.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Only by doing so will I live on in your memory.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I'll ask you, how did your day go, Ebenholz?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: And you'll tell me proudly that you had a good and productive day.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: You'll tell me about the challenges you face while doing good, and complain about how fate is a miser.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: And it will be okay, because I'll be listening.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: It's alright to complain a little, when you've worked so hard.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Only by doing so will you rise above pain and suffering, and find peace in your heart.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Remember that we've fought together against cruel fate and won.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: When you think of me, laugh. Don't cry.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: So, don't...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Don't go, don't go––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Wait!!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Enough!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Huh? You're crying?
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Looks like you finally understand the situation you're in.
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Ebenholz pulls back a drawer within the room, revealing a solitary cello bow. It is a memento left by Kreide's previous teacher.
Ebenholz carefully wraps up the bow, and takes it with him.
Good sir, do you remember when you first arrived at the scene of the incident? You confiscated my cello. Where is it?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: We're holding on to it, it is an important piece of evidence––
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Then how come I remember you taking it into Afterglow Hall, dawdling around for a good long while, then coming out empty-handed?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Nonsense. You––
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Get back here! The sun's about to go down! Where do you think you're going?!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: The Infected is still there, but he has stopped trying to approach Afterglow Hall.
He stands in the plaza in despair, as if about to be blown away by the wind.
He doesn't even notice Ebenholz's arrival.
How dare you cross the cordon?! The situation has changed! This is the Empresses' Voice we're talking about now––
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: You talk too much for a 'tail.'
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You dare draw your wand on me?!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Unfortunately, I don't know any silencing Arts. I'll admit, I'm not as skilled as you in this regard.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But, I can get you to stay put for a while.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Oh, the plainclothes guard is here too?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Good, now nobody will get in the way.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Tell me, Herr Tail, you wouldn't have happened to hide the cello in Afterglow Hall, would you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Entry to that area is strictly prohibited. If you think you can get away with––
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Unfortunately, there's a cello behind the entrance to Afterglow Hall, quite similar to the one I gave to Kreide.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hidden in plain view, Herr Tail. I must say, you're quite smart.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Put that cello down right now!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Please forgive me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't know what you did with the bow, but... I happen to have a spare.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Alright. This 'die Melodie für Morgen' is for you out there––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Err, no, it's for each and every one of you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (*whispers*) And you too... Kreide.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (*whispers*) I'm not waiting for tomorrow. I'll be complaining to you, just for tonight.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (*whispers*) I'm going to complain so much you'll grow sick of my annoying voice.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Is this... 'die Melodie für Morgen'?!
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: You're committing a crime, Graf Urtica! Do you want to bring even more ruin upon Vyseheim with your Originium Arts?!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: On the contrary, Herr Tail. This is just an ordinary piece of music with no Arts involved.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I will continue to play. I will play the songs of the Infected that you don't want to hear, one by one.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If you don't want to listen, just plug your own ears. Why hold down somebody else's strings?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Is that... Graf Urtica? He's performing?!
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: Graf... Err, Ebenholz!
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: Ebenholz, thank you! Thank you for your music!
attributes.name: Despondent Infected

attributes.content: You're amazing, Ebenholz! We're listening; we're all going to keep listening! I'll accompany you––
attributes.name: Emotional Infected

attributes.content: Wait, you over there, put your instrument down!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Emotional Infected

attributes.content: Now that the Stadtrat has explicitly banned non-approved music, I'd recommend you refrain from joining me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Emotional Infected

attributes.content: This today is just something I decided to do on my own. There's no need to get yourself involved, so just sit back and listen, alright?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz?!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: The one who brought music back to the Afterglow... was you?!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: On behalf of the entire Afterglow, thank you... But please, stop that right now! Your situation is already dire!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I appreciate the concern, but I'm not going to stop.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This is my performance, and I'm not letting you steal my spotlight!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Calm down and think this through, Ebenholz!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You misunderstand me, Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Didn't you remind me not to forget Kreide's words? It's thanks to you that I finally remembered.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Fate is cruel and unjust, but I was so stricken by grief that I forgot to fight back.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But now, I've remembered.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If there are those seeking to silence the people, then I shall give them a voice.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If it becomes a crime to pay homage, then I shall offer up a bouquet of fresh flowers.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And if anyone tries to lock me up in a so-called noble spire, then I'll blow the damned thing to smithereens!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You... You've gone too far this time!
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Ah, perfect timing, Herr Tail. Please remember to include this in your report!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Unless your verdict is to get rid of me altogether, I'm done with this place!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And, most importantly, I hereby renounce my noble status!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Nobility is a shame that I can no longer tolerate for even a single day!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You've gone mad! This is unprecedented! You––
attributes.name: Aloof Noble

attributes.content: Then call me mad! Say I chose the path of madness after long and careful deliberation!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But now, 'die Melodie für Morgen' is coming to an end, my beloved Infected brothers and sisters!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let me see your faces, and consider your tastes...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: 'Goldenpokal und Silberbesteck.' If I remember properly, the bearded man in the back liked to hum that song. That'll be the next piece I play.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then, the third song, 'Winter Wanderlust,' will be dedicated to our tough tailor lady.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The fourth piece, 'Piano Sonata in F-Major, Opus 81, 'An die Freiheit,' is dedicated to you.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: Biegler––?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Alright. As long as I have the skills to adapt that piece for cello, then it'll be the fourth!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Next up is, 'Goldenpokal und Silberbesteck'! Listen well!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Using his unpolished cello skills, he continues to perform one piece after another.
As if in a frenzy, the gathered Infected begin to weep, laugh, and mourn in the plaza until the Stadtrat rushes to the scene.
He is just like them.
With tears in his eyes, he smiles.
